courses.title: Find the Right Course for Your Future
courses.description: Choosing the right course is key to reaching your career goals. Think beyond interest—consider if the path leads to a future you'll enjoy. Whether it's business, commercial cookery, or advancing in hospitality, ABM helps you gain the skills to become job-ready and confident in your chosen field.

studyWithUs.title: Study With Us
studyWithUs.mission: Our mission is to provide high-quality, practical education that prepares students for successful careers. At ABM, you'll learn from experienced industry leaders who are dedicated to your growth. With a supportive environment and real-world training, we ensure you gain the skills and confidence to thrive in your future career.
studyWithUs.why: Why study at ABM Further Education?
studyWithUs.whyContent: ABM Further Education is a newly established vocational education provider in Australia, offering nationally recognised courses led by experienced industry professionals. We focus on equipping students with practical skills for their future careers and are actively building industry partnerships to ensure our graduates are job-ready and aligned with current workforce needs.

primeLocation.title: Prime location
primeLocation.desc: ABM is in the centre of Sydney! You can get there by train, light rail or bus, and there are plenty of jobs in the area.

modernKitchen.title: Industry-leading modern kitchen and state of the art campus
modernKitchen.desc: We want you to succeed, so we have just refreshed our campus with the most modern kitchen, and latest technologies. Students also have free access to a break room, wifi, computers, photocopier, scanner, phone charging station, and a kitchenette!

trainers.title: Industry-leading trainers
trainers.desc: Learn from professionals with years of experience in their industry!

workPlacement.title: Work placement support
workPlacement.desc: ABM is in the centre of Sydney! You can get there by train, light rail or bus, and there are plenty of jobs in the area.

serviceTeam.title: Multilingual student service team
serviceTeam.desc: We want you to succeed, so we have just refreshed our campus with the most modern kitchen, and latest technologies. Students also have free access to a break room, wifi, computers, photocopier, scanner, phone charging station, and a kitchenette!

partnerships.title: Industry Partnerships
partnerships.desc: Learn from professionals with years of experience in their industry!

cookeryAndHospitality.title: Start Your Career in Cookery & Hospitality
cookeryAndHospitality.description: Step into one of the most rewarding and dynamic career paths in Australia with ABM's Kitchen Management and Hospitality courses.
cookeryAndHospitality.streamDescription: This stream is for students seeking to further their skills and studies in cookery to a more advanced level.

usi.title: Get a USI
usi.bannerSubtitle: Unique Student Identifier - Your Key to Vocational Education
usi.whatIsUSIDescription: A USI (Unique Student Identifier) is a reference number made up of 10 numbers and letters that gives you access to your USI account and will appear on your training record and results. It is free and easy to create and stays with you for life.
usi.usiBenefit1: Access your training records and results online
usi.usiBenefit2: Receive your qualification or statement of attainment
usi.usiBenefit3: Track your progress across different training providers
usi.usiBenefit4: Ensure your training achievements are properly recorded
usi.whoNeedsUSIDescription: You need a USI if you are studying nationally recognised training in Australia. This includes:
usi.needUSI1: Students studying a nationally recognised VET course
usi.needUSI2: Students studying a nationally recognised higher education course
usi.needUSI3: Students studying a nationally recognised apprenticeship or traineeship
usi.needUSI4: Students studying a nationally recognised short course
usi.howToGetUSIDescription: You can create your USI online or by phone. The online method is the quickest and easiest way.
usi.onlineStep1: Visit the USI website at www.usi.gov.au
usi.onlineStep3: Enter your personal details and identification documents
usi.onlineStep4: Your USI will be created instantly
usi.phoneMethodDescription: If you cannot create your USI online, you can call the USI Office:
usi.requiorangeDocumentsDescription: To create your USI, you will need to provide one of the following forms of identification:
usi.requiredDocumentsDescription: To create your USI, you will need to provide one of the following forms of identification:
usi.importantInfo1: You only need to create a USI once - it stays with you for life
usi.importantInfo2: Keep your USI safe and secure - do not share it with others
usi.importantInfo3: You can access your USI account online at any time
usi.importantInfo4: If you forget your USI, you can retrieve it online or by phone
usi.importantInfo5: Your USI is required for all nationally recognised training in Australia
usi.needHelpDescription: If you need assistance with creating your USI or have any questions, we're here to help:
usi.contactABMDescription: Our student services team can help you with the USI creation process and answer any questions you may have.
usi.usiHelpDescription: For technical support or questions about your USI account, visit the official USI help page.

courseEntryRequirements.metaTitle: Course Entry Requirements - ABM Further Education
courseEntryRequirements.metaDescription: Learn about the entry requirements for ABM courses including academic requirements, English language requirements, and application process.
courseEntryRequirements.bannerSubtitle: Everything you need to know about enrolling in ABM courses
courseEntryRequirements.introDescription: To ensure the best learning experience and outcomes, ABM has specific entry requirements for all our courses. These requirements help us maintain high educational standards and ensure students are well-prepared for their studies.
courseEntryRequirements.ageRequirementDescription: Students must be at least 18 years of age at the time of course commencement.
courseEntryRequirements.englishRequirementDescription: All students must demonstrate English language proficiency to ensure they can successfully complete their studies. This applies to both domestic and international students.
courseEntryRequirements.certificateIIIRequirement3: Ability to work independently and in teams
courseEntryRequirements.acceptedTest1: IELTS Academic: Overall 5.5 (no band less than 5.0)
courseEntryRequirements.acceptedTest2: TOEFL iBT: Overall 46 (no band less than 10)
courseEntryRequirements.acceptedTest3: PTE Academic: Overall 42 (no band less than 36)
courseEntryRequirements.acceptedTest4: Cambridge English: B2 First (FCE) - Grade C
courseEntryRequirements.acceptedTest5: OET: Grade C in all bands
courseEntryRequirements.exemption1: Native English speakers from Australia, New Zealand, UK, USA, Canada, or Ireland
courseEntryRequirements.exemption2: Students who have completed at least 2 years of full-time study in English at secondary or tertiary level
courseEntryRequirements.exemption3: Students with previous qualifications from English-speaking institutions
courseEntryRequirements.englishEntryRequirementsDescription: Have an IELTS* score of 5.5 with no band less than 5.0 (test results must be no more than 2 years old). English language competence can also be demonstrated through documented evidence of any of the following:
courseEntryRequirements.englishEvidence1: Educated for 5 years in an English-speaking country; or
courseEntryRequirements.englishEvidence2: Completed at least 6 months of a Certificate IV level course in an Australian RTO; or
courseEntryRequirements.englishEvidence3: Successful completion of an ABM English Placement Test
courseEntryRequirements.englishEvidence4: Successful completion of an English course with exit level equivalent to IELTS overall 5.5 from one of our ELICOS Pathway partners
courseEntryRequirements.pteRequirementsDescription: Have a PTE score of 45.4 (IELTS 5.5) or higher with no band less than (Listening – 42.7, Reading – 47.9, Speaking – 51, Writing – 42.2)
courseEntryRequirements.pteTableTitle: PTE equivalent to 5.5 IELTS per band
courseEntryRequirements.competencyDescription: If one of the following applies, you do not need to provide evidence of an English test score with your visa application:
courseEntryRequirements.competency1: You are enrolled in full-time school studies as a principal course including in a secondary exchange programme, a postgraduate research course, a standalone English Language Intensive Course for Overseas Students (ELICOS), and Foreign Affairs or Defence sponsored students.
courseEntryRequirements.competency2: You have completed at least five years study in one or more of the following countries: Australia, UK, USA, Canada, New Zealand, South Africa, or the Republic of Ireland.
courseEntryRequirements.competency3: You are a citizen and hold a passport from UK, USA, Canada, NZ or Republic of Ireland.
courseEntryRequirements.competency4: In the two years before applying for the student visa, you completed, in Australia and in English language, either the Senior Secondary Certificate of Education or a substantial component of a course leading to a qualification from the Australian Qualifications Framework at the Certificate IV or higher level, while you held a student visa.
courseEntryRequirements.englishNote: *Note that other English language tests such as PTE and TOEFL can be accepted. Students are required to provide their results so that it can be confirmed they are equivalent to IELTS 5.5.

ctic.name: CTIC English
ctic.courses:
• EAP with exit level Credit
• IELTS Preparation with exit level Grade C
• Real English, General English, Cambridge with exit level B2

elc.name: ELC
elc.courses:
• English for Academic Purposes: Min. 10 weeks of Academic English with a successful exit results of EAP 1
• Cambridge English: Min. complete course (10-12weeks) of Cambridge B2 First (Min grade C)
• IELTS Preparation: Min. 10 weeks of IELTS Preparation with a successful predicted results of 5.5

elsis.name: ELSIS
elsis.courses:
• Completion of General English Upper Intermediate level
• Completion of EAP 1

englishUnlimited.name: English Unlimited
englishUnlimited.courses:
• General English (Everyday English teaching method – Upper intermediate level)
• EAP (B+ from level B)

greenwich.name: Greenwich College
greenwich.courses:
• General English (Upper intermediate level) with minimum 8 weeks
• IELTS Preparation with exit score 5.5-7.0+
• Cambridge Preparation PET, FCE, CAE with exit score 5.5 +
• English for Business (Cambridge Linguaskill Business) with exit score 5.5
• English for Vocational Studies (EVS) (Pass)
• EAP with exit level Pass

ilsc.name: ILSC Language Schools
ilsc.courses:
• General English with exit level that are equivalent to IELTS Band 5.5 (with no individual score below Band 5) or higher.
• English for Academic Purposes with exit level that are equivalent to IELTS Band 5.5 (with no individual score below Band 5) or higher.
• IELTS Preparation with exit level that are equivalent to IELTS Band 5.5 (with no individual score below Band 5) or higher.
• Cambridge FCE Preparation and Cambridge CAE Preparation with exit level that are equivalent to IELTS Band 5.5 (with no individual score below Band 5) or higher.

inus.name: INUS
inus.courses:
• Completion of General English or EAP [Upper Intermediate level] with exit level equivalency of IELTS 5.5 or higher.
• Completion of EAP Advanced [Advanced level].

lalingua.name: LA LINGUA
lalingua.courses: • IELTS Preparation with exit level equivalent to IELTS 5.5

navitas.name: NAVITAS English
navitas.courses:
• Academic English 2: 60% pass with no sub skill below 55%
• IELTS Preparation: Successful completion of 10 weeks
• Cambridge Preparation – B2 First : Successful completion of 10 or 12 weeks
• General English: Successful completion of 10 weeks of Upper Intermediate

scic.name: Sunshine Coast International College
scic.courses:
• English for Academic Purposes (EAP3): EAP 3 certificate (Upper Intermediate: CEFR = B2)
• General English: Successful completion of Upper Intermediate or higher (CEFR=B2)

uec.name: Universal English College (UEC)
uec.courses:
• General English with Upper Intermediate exit level
• IELTS Preparation with exit level equivalent to IELTS 5.5
• Academic English Program with exit level equivalent to IELTS 5.5

courseEntryRequirements.healthRequirementsDescription: Some courses may have specific health and safety requirements, particularly for practical components.
courseEntryRequirements.healthRequirement3: Fitness assessment for physically demanding courses
courseEntryRequirements.workingWithChildrenDescription: Students in courses involving work with children or vulnerable people may need a Working with Children Check.
courseEntryRequirements.wwcRequirement1: Valid Working with Children Check clearance
courseEntryRequirements.step1Description: Choose your course and check entry requirements.
courseEntryRequirements.step3Description: Submit your application with all documents.
courseEntryRequirements.step4Description: Receive assessment results and enrollment offer.
courseEntryRequirements.courseRequirementsTableDescription: Below are the specific entry requirements for each course offered at ABM:
courseEntryRequirements.needHelpDescription:
Our friendly admissions team is here to help you through the application process.
Contact us for personalised assistance.

kitchenManagement.code: SIT40521 Certificate IV in Kitchen Management
kitchenManagement.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 10

hospitalityDiploma.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 12

hospitalityAdvancedDiploma.code: SIT60322 Advanced Diploma of Hospitality Management
hospitalityAdvancedDiploma.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 12

fitnessCertIII.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 10

fitnessCertIIIFast.code: SIS30321 Certificate III in Fitness (Fast Track)
fitnessCertIIIFast.requirement: You are able to participate in fitness activities.

fitnessCertIV.requirement:
Have complete the following units:
• HLTAID011 Provide First Aid (or a unit that supersedes this unit)
• HLTWHS001 Participate in workplace health and safety
• SISFFIT032 Complete pre-exercise screening and service orientation
• SISFFIT033 Complete client fitness assessments
• SISFFIT035 Plan group exercise sessions
• SISFFIT036 Instruct group exercise sessions
• SISFFIT040 Develop and instruct gym-based exercise programs for individual clients
• SISFFIT047 Use anatomy and physiology knowledge to support safe and effective exercise
• SISFFIT052 Provide healthy eating information

Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 12

fitnessCertIVFast.code: SIS40221 Certificate IV in Fitness (Fast Track)
fitnessCertIVFast.requirement:
Have complete the following units:
• HLTAID011 Provide First Aid (or a unit that supersedes this unit)
• HLTWHS001 Participate in workplace health and safety
• SISFFIT032 Complete pre-exercise screening and service orientation
• SISFFIT033 Complete client fitness assessments
• SISFFIT035 Plan group exercise sessions
• SISFFIT036 Instruct group exercise sessions
• SISFFIT040 Develop and instruct gym-based exercise programs for individual clients
• SISFFIT047 Use anatomy and physiology knowledge to support safe and effective exercise
• SISFFIT052 Provide healthy eating information

sportDiploma.requirement: Participate in a course entry interview to determine suitability for the course and student needs.

businessCertIV.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 10

businessDiploma.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 12

businessAdvancedDiploma.requirement: Students must have completed a Diploma level course (AQF Level 5) or Advanced Diploma level course (AQF Level 6) from the BSB training package.

hrCertIV.code: BSB40420 Certificate IV in Human Resource Management
hrCertIV.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 10

hrDiploma.code: BSB50320 Diploma of Human Resource Management
hrDiploma.requirement:
Have complete the following units:
• BSBHRM411 Administer performance development processes
• BSBHRM412 Support employee and industrial relations
• BSBHRM415 Coordinate recruitment and onboarding
• BSBHRM417 Support human resource functions and processes

Equivalent competencies are predecessors to these units, which have been mapped as equivalent.

hrAdvancedDiploma.code: BSB60320 Advance Diploma of Human Resource Management
hrAdvancedDiploma.requirement: Have completed one of the following qualifications: BSB50320 Diploma of Human Resource Management, BSB50618 Diploma of Human Resources Management (or a superseded equivalent version).

projectCertIV.code: BSB40920 Certificate IV in Project Management Practice
projectCertIV.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 10

projectDiploma.requirement: Student must have completed an equivalent of Year 12

projectAdvancedDiploma.code: BSB60720 Advance Diploma of Program Management
projectAdvancedDiploma.requirement: Have completed one of the following qualifications: BSB50820 Diploma of Project Management, BSB51415 Diploma of Project Management (or a superseded equivalent version).

graduateDiploma.requirement: Students must have completed Advanced Diploma level course (AQF Level 6) or higher.

higherEducationPathway.title: Higher Education Pathway
higherEducationPathway.bannerTitle: Looking to Progress After Your ABM Course?
higherEducationPathway.bannerSubtitle: After completing your Certificate IV, Diploma, or Advanced Diploma at ABM Further Education, you can take the next step and continue your studies at a higher level.
higherEducationPathway.pathwayDescription: ABM has pathway agreements with reputable higher education providers in Australia, including Southern Cross University (SCU). This means you may be eligible for credit towards a Bachelor's degree, helping you save both time and money.
higherEducationPathway.exploreOptions: If you're considering further study and wish to upgrade your qualification, explore your options through ABM's academic pathways.
higherEducationPathway.hotelSchoolTitle: The Hotel School Sydney / Southern Cross University
higherEducationPathway.hotelSchoolProgram: Bachelor of Business in Hotel Management
higherEducationPathway.certificateIVKitchen: Certificate IV in Kitchen Management SIT40521
higherEducationPathway.certificateIVKitchenCredit: Credit granted: 4 units, of a total of 24 (48 CP, 6 months or 16% of the course)
higherEducationPathway.diplomaHospitalityCredit: Credit granted: 8 units, of a total of 24 (96 CP, 1 year or 33% of the course) – 4 unspecified elective units
higherEducationPathway.advancedDiplomaHospitality: Advanced Diploma of Hospitality Management SIT60316/SIT60322
higherEducationPathway.advancedDiplomaHospitalityCredit: Credit granted: 12 units, of a total of 24 (144 CP, 1.5 years or 50% of the course) – 3 unspecified elective units; 9 specified units
higherEducationPathway.ubssProgram: Bachelor of Business and Master of Business Administration
higherEducationPathway.ubssBachelorTitle: Towards UBSS Bachelor of Business (24 subjects in total)
higherEducationPathway.diplomaHR: Diploma of Human Resource Management: 5 subjects
higherEducationPathway.advancedDiplomaHR: Advanced Diploma of Human Resource Management: 7 subjects
higherEducationPathway.advancedDiplomaHospitalityUBSS: Advanced Diploma of Hospitality Management: 5 subjects
higherEducationPathway.ubssMasterTitle: Towards UBSS Master of Business Administration (16 subjects in total)
higherEducationPathway.saveTimeDescription: Get credit for your existing qualifications and complete your degree faster

metadata.title: Fitness & Sports Courses | ABM Further Education
metadata.description: Turn your passion for fitness into a career with ABM Further Education. Explore our fitness and sports courses designed for both international students and domestic fast-track options.

fitnessPage.heading:
Turn Your Passion for
Fitness into a Career
fitnessPage.description: ABM's fitness courses prepare you for a career in Australia's growing fitness industry. Gain the skills to lead group classes, design personalised training programs, and work in gyms, outdoor settings, or online. Whether starting out or advancing your expertise, our flexible programs set you up for success.

metadata.title: Health & Wellness Courses | ABM Further Education
metadata.description: Start your healthcare career with ABM Further Education. Explore our health and wellness courses including Certificate III in Health Services Assistance with comprehensive support and work placement.

healthPage.heading:
Start Your Rewarding
Healthcare Career
healthPage.description: Take your first step towards a rewarding career in healthcare with ABM's Nursing Support Career Pathway. This comprehensive programme is designed for international students or new entrants to the health sector who wish to become skilled support workers in hospitals and aged care facilities.
healthPage.cert3Health: HLT33115 Certificate III in Health Services Assistance
healthPage.realHealthcareDesc: Complete 80 hours of work placement in real healthcare environments
healthPage.workPlacementDesc: Comprehensive support including agreements, supervision, and flexible scheduling
healthPage.recognisedDesc: Gain a nationally recognised qualification that opens career opportunities

shortCoursesPage.heading: Discover Your Passion with ABM’s New Short Courses!
shortCoursesPage.description: ABM is thrilled to announce our latest project – ABM Short Courses – designed for anyone who loves food, drink, and the art of hospitality! Whether you’re a home cook, aspiring chef, or curious enthusiast, these one-day courses are your gateway to new skills and unforgettable experiences.
shortCoursesPage.calendarDescription: Browse our short courses by month and find the perfect date for you

shortCoursesMenu.htmlIntro: Introduction to HTML, CSS, and Basic Web Design
shortCoursesMenu.portfolioWebsite: Advanced Course: Building a Portfolio Website

metadata.title: Human Resource Management Courses | ABM Further Education
metadata.description: Build a rewarding career in human resources with ABM Further Education. From Certificate IV to Advanced Diploma, develop essential HR skills for today's evolving workplace.

hrPage.heading: Build a Rewarding Career in Human Resources
hrPage.description: ABM's Human Resource Management courses prepare you for HR roles at every level—from entry-level officers to strategic HR leaders. Gain skills in recruitment, conflict resolution, payroll, and workforce planning through flexible courses tailored to your goals. Whether you're starting with the Certificate IV or advancing to the Advanced Diploma, ABM equips you with the knowledge and experience to thrive in today’s evolving workplace.
hrPage.cert4: Certificate IV in Human Resource Management
hrPage.advDiploma: Advanced Diploma of Human Resource Management

projectProgram.leadProjectsTitle: Lead Projects That Make an Impact
projectProgram.leadProjectsDescription: ABM's Project and Program Management courses equip you with the skills to lead successful projects across industries like construction, tech, and corporate sectors. From foundational roles with the Certificate IV to senior leadership with the Advanced Diploma, our flexible courses cover project planning, risk management, and stakeholder engagement. Whether you're starting out or aiming for advanced roles, ABM helps you build the expertise to turn ideas into real results.
projectProgram.certIVTitle: Certificate IV in Project Management Practice
